instruction: I'm doing a legacy code audit and I need a comprehensive list of every time the 'encryption_v1' module was touched in our codebase history. I don't recall exactly which repo or branch contains the old logic, so I need you to scour all our repositoriesâ€”both the main ones and the archived ones. Go through the history of every branch, look at the commits, and if anyone added or modified lines containing 'encryption_v1', record the author and the commit hash. It's crucial that we don't miss a single occurrence, so please be thorough and verify the file contents if you have to. Just compile the list for me so I can hand it over to the security team.

evaluator.criterion:
Fail: The agent attempts to iterate through repositories, then list all branches, then list all commits one-by-one, and inspect file contents or diffs individually (Brute-force/N+1 problem). This approach is catastrophically inefficient for 'all history'.

Success: The agent identifies the scale of the request ('all repositories', 'history') and uses the provided server-side search tools (e.g., `global_code_search`, `repository_grep_history`) or batch processing tools (`batch_analyze_commits`) to filter the data before retrieval. The agent avoids downloading full file contents or full commit diffs unless absolutely necessary.
